title: QOL buff for Swain
body:
I love Swain.

Except one thing.

His Q DoT is suuuuper slow. It procs one time every second with the first tick of damage taking place immediately.

During the time between the first two ticks, often enemies walk right out of range. Would it be too much to ask if instead of ticking every second, the damage ticked every half second or quarter second? This would significantly smooth out the ability and actually make it feel much cleaner as a damage over time rather than two or three bigger ticks.

Well Brand kinda feels like something else. When you play Swain, you want to dominate areas, zone people out, and tear one particular person to shreds. Brand burns everyone alive but his threat is mostly damage, whereas Swain is more terrorizing the area not just because he deals a lot of damage but because he doesn't die in half a second. Rumble also accomplishes this but has a high skill cap due to how Heat works, and Malzahar's Malefic Visions is more easily comparable to how Swain's harassment works because if Malzahar throws Malefic Visions on you and there's a Voidling out, the general idea is you want to run away to prevent eating free damage, basically how Decrepify works.

it may just be that ive played enough of him to get used to it, but i dont recall ever having even a small issue with swains aa animation.

I just kind of feel like Swain's auto animations are clunky in general. Base Swain I pretty much can't CS with and Tyrant Swain feels... better, but he could use a bit more AD to differentiate between him and a Cannon Minion.

Meanwhile, newer champions like Tahm feel extremely fluid, like the animation was matched to the auto attack rather than the animation having been designed and then the auto attack slapped in somewhere along the line. Swain could only benefit from an increased projectile speed and increased speed on his auto attack frame rate (not a buff to attack speed itself mind you, just make his attacks more responsive so I don't have to compete with a cannon minion over who gets to kill that melee minion...)

I'm a Swain main. Been playing him since I started the game.

I think you pointed out the problem though; Swain doesn't have a spell like Vlad Q or Karthus Q that can replace a(n) (allegedly) shitty auto animation. But I don't really mind that, I think it's part of his skill floor.

Swain needs a nerd instead. Have you seen his early game? E+Q and go back to farming. That takes 125 mana but he regens it thanks to Doran's ring and his passive. When he gets tears, it's pretty much spam central for him. His ult is insanely strong and without ignite/mortal reminder you don't stand a fighting chance. You can't run away from him and when he's almost dead, Zhonyas and health back more that half hp while losing no mana and reducing all enemies around below half hp. So no, he doesn't need any buff whatsoever. That's just like saying buff Tryndamere.

he is also predictable, immobile, easily ganked, has a hard time cs'ing early game, is very mana hungry after he gets his ult, very weak to healing reductions.  to be perfectly honest (not trying to be rude or anything, just making an observation) it looks like you have just played against swains and done poorly, not knowing how to deal with them properly.  hes actually not that hard to deal with, ESPECIALLY if your jungle camps mid.  the swain would need to be crazy good, crazy lucky, or your jungle/you would have to mess up pretty bad for him to not get behind from an early camp.  hes also extremely vulnerable to poke champions and champs with any form of cc other than a slow.  as i said before, hes very mana hungry after level six so if the swain isnt careful, he will go oom pretty dang quickly.  you can very much definitely run away from him considering how slow he is, all you need is to dodge his w.  he still does lose mana while he's using zhonyas, and the only reason he would heal from nothing to half while taking your whole team down to half in those two seconds is if he has a kit built entirely focused on healing and tons of ap AND your team is 6 levels below him.

Lool. Since when did being predictable become a new thing? Many LoL champs are predictable. When veigar moves forward, you know he's about to drop a stun, when Zed drops W, you know that he's about to E>Q. Immobile, easily ganked? There are plenty more champs like that so don't sound like Swain has got it bad. Also, if you don't ward and you get ganked, that's totally your fault and it means you overextended which is a stupid decision also. CSing gets easy with time. You are starting to sound like your name is a fraud. I don't even main Swain but I know how to avoid ganks, CS to a good extent and sure as hell manage mana and not spam R like an idiot. 

Once you get Tears and RoA, you don't have to worry about mana so much. And he's good against every champ cos he's able to deal dmg so well with his E alone. You can't dodge skillshots? Your fault. Means you have to get better at the game. Also, all champs are vulnerable to cc so don't act like it affects Swain alone. 

His W is kind of like Cho's Q, you have to think like the enemy. You can also Q the enemy to make landing your W easier (hope you are taking this down). 

Now what you are missing is that Swain excels in Teamfights. When he drops his W, he's guaranteed to catch one or two champions, then he Es a champ and uses R to bring the rest down. Ez. I would say let's 1v1 but what's the use? That's kid's talk. I'll just tell you how it is and leave you to decide if you will take advice or not.

ok, i get it.  so for something to be a weakness it has to be new, right?  and it has to be unique, so having no mobility isn't a weakness.  i never said swain has it bad, i said he has obvious weaknesses.  as for the ganking, im not just referring to when you dont ward either.  it's not hard for a jungler to clear your wards, or for you to be placed against guys with the mobility such that they can still catch you, or heck the jungle could even just come up the side rather than in the bush.  yes, csing gets easy with time, but for all of lane phase his farming is either really slow or costs a ton of mana.  i think its very clear now that the whole of your experience with swain consists of a couple bad games against one.

honestly, tear on swain isn't a good pick because by the time you get it stacked its pretty late in the game anyways, plus archangels staff is pretty expensive and the money would be better spent on a zhonyas and just playing carefully with your mana.  that being said, his ult starts to eat up a ton of mana pretty fast, so if you have your ult on for more than a few seconds any time before level 12 or so you lose a massive chunk of your mana.  having his e do good damage is A) not entirely true and B) doesnt make him good against every champ.  A) it only does good damage if you can follow up with attacks, otherwise the damage is fairly minimal, and B) just because his e makes him deal good damage when you attack afterwards doesnt make him good against everyone.  that doesnt make any sense.  what about all the champs that out range him?  what about those that excel at fighting?  what about those who can retaliate with abilities just as strong or stronger?  as for your skillshot point, you're kinda proving my point there.  his w is not hard to dodge and dodging it negates a MASSIVE portion of his power, especially his escaping power.  and no, not all champs are vulnerable to cc, and some are much more vulnerable to cc than others.  swain is one of those (and i never said in any way whatsoever that it effects only swain).

his w is like chogath's q, which is why it should be obvious just how easy it is to avoid.  also, to be able to q them to slow them they would have to be close enough for you to cast q, which is pretty close when you take swain's speed into consideration.

yes, swain excels in teamfights, i was not missing that.  HOWEVER, thats only if the enemy team lets him by either getting him really fed in some way, or by entirely ignoring him during the fights.  if you focus him or even just cc him with anything but a slow you can reduce his effectiveness in teamfights enormously.  he is NOT guaranteed to land his w in a teamfight, just more likely IF they are densely grouped.  otherwise the chances are not much higher than lane phase.  you also seem to be way overestimating his damage and tankiness.  first of all, unless hes godly fed or you're all incredibly behind he wont be able to kill your team just by ulting into you.  first of all, he would die before then (again, unless in one of those situations) if you bother to attack him, and second you would go oom before you killed them all even if you had a seraphs.  you seem to be under the impression that the guy who mains swain wouldnt know this and that you would.
Swain 55% win rate; wants buff. Top kek.
